content.description:
A good left to right traverse with the crux at the end!

Sit start at the left arete as for Brilliant Trees. Make a few hard pulls and traverse right to the Cueball start hold. Make similar moves as for Cueball, the medium sized pocket down from the sloping arete on Cueball isn't used. With difficulty reach around the right arete to small pockets and get your feet set and do a weird gliding dyno move using your leg swing and grab the good holds on the lip. Go rightward and finish with a fun mantel.

There is also static beta using the small pockets.
content.location: Left traversing around the low right arete and finishing on the horizontal lip beyond the arete.

content.description:
Sit start as for Brilliant Trees on the left side of the face. Make a hard pull up right hand to a good but awkward and sharp finger jug. Get the left hand up and then make your way right staying low and using hidden good holds and doing some difficult pulls. Get to the Cueball start holds and finish up that line.

Better have Cueball dialed unless going for the flash!

Pumpy traverse with a heartbreaking finish!
content.location: The Shadow Play cave. Left arete traversing all the way to the right arete.

content.description:
A fun but painful climb. Bring tape, superglue and some sandpaper for this one.

Start as for Brilliant Trees and pull up and head rightward staying low. There are a lot of different options for holds during the traverse, the good ones are Hard to find. Once at the starting jug of Cueball climb straight up and finish on the small sharp and painful pockets of Carnivore Hate Devil.

High feet and a little screaming might be useful when going up from the shallow two finger pocket.
content.location: Start left and finish Carnivore Hate Devil

content.description: Sit start at the large undercling and move up with big moves on great holds.   Move slightly right and then up and right to finish.

Sit start at a good side pull to the right of

Spinal Snap

.   Pull on and then up and left to join

Spinal Snap

for the finishing moves.
content.location: Right of center of the cave

content.description: Climb directly up the slabby face on its left side.
content.location: Left side of the North West face

content.description:
Sit start at the good pocket in the middle of the cave.   Move right on good pockets to the arete, which is turned with difficulty.

Depending on height either make some hard sharp pulls on pockets then move up to the lip of the wall, or if tall enough reach around to the best pocket (the highest one) and reach directly to the lip.

Finish easily up the slab above.

Sit start at the good pocket in the middle of the cave.   Pull out right and then up to the arete via a pocket which you think should be much better than it feels.

With right hand on the arete launch up and left to either the top jug or a side pull then the top jug.

A good steep problem on slopers, best left to cool afternoons.

Sit start at the large pocket, and climb more or less directly up the wall.

The crux comes with a hard pull on a small pocket in the middle of the blank looking section of rock.

Good footwork helps, as do strong fingers...
Sit start, and make a couple of steep pulls up onto the arete.  Finish up the arete on better holds.

Climb directly up the face with a couple of long moves to get established on the slab.

A great problem in a great position.
content.location: Middle of the North West face
